block.label: Logistics

radio.label: Location
radio.title: Sample Source (web) / Location (web to clt)
radio.row: Oi Research- Online Interactive Research Limited

text.label: LocationCode
text.title: This is used to assign each location's unique identifying code from the Location question row label. Do not edit.

block.note: Edit logic based on country - if one country, use "True", if multiple countries, assign based on sample company. Make sure field department knows to alert you if they are adding a sample company

autofill.label: JobNumber
autofill.title: AD572 Johnson's Baby UK - PackFlash 360 - US - Teaneck

html.label: Intro
html.p:
Hello and welcome to our survey!
Thank you in advance for your participation.  This study is very important to us and we ask that you answer each question carefully and completely.
While going through the survey, please use the scroll bar on the right and bottom of your screen to move up and down through questions and images.  Please remember that there are no right or wrong answers.  We are only interested in your opinions.
Thank you again!  Let’s begin…

autofill.label: Category
autofill.title: Category
autofill.row: Baby Toiletry (e.g., baby shampoo, lotion, wash)

autofill.label: Months
autofill.title: Enter number of months here 1,3,6,12 for past purchased, BUMO

checkbox.label: S_PastParticipation
checkbox.title: Have you participated in a market research study within the past 2 weeks, on any of the following topics?

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you, or anyone in your immediate family, work for any of the following industries?
checkbox.row: Advertising agency or Public Relations Firms
A graphic design or packaging firm
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of hair care products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of oral care products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of baby toiletry products

term.label: TERM_Industry
term.cond: (S_Industry.r1 or S_Industry.r2 or S_Industry.r3 or S_Industry.r6)

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: With which gender do you identify?

radio.label: S_Child
radio.title: Do you have any children aged 12 or under who live at home?

radio.label: S_Child_Age
radio.title: How old is your youngest child?

radio.label: S_First_child
radio.title: Have you had your first child within the last 3 years?

radio.label: S_Frequency
radio.title: How often do you typically purchase products in each of the following categories?
radio.row: Baby Toiletry (e.g., baby shampoo, lotion, wash)
Adult Hair Care (e.g., adult shampoo, conditioner, styling products)

radio.label: v_FreqClutter1
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter1] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r2.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r2.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r2.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r2.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r2.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r2.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r2.c7: data.val=6 if S_Frequency.r2.c8: data.val=7

radio.label: v_FreqClutter2
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter2] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r1.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r1.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r1.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r1.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r1.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r1.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r1.c7: data.val=6 if S_Frequency.r1.c8: data.val=7

radio.label: v_FreqTest
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Category] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.TB.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.TB.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.TB.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.TB.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.TB.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.TB.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.TB.c7: data.val=6 if S_Frequency.TB.c8: data.val=7

checkbox.label: S_Category_Type
checkbox.title: Which, if any, of the following baby toiletry products do you typically purchase?

term.label: termCat1
term.cond: not (S_Category_Type.r1 or S_Category_Type.r2 or S_Category_Type.r3 or S_Category_Type.r4 or S_Category_Type.r5 or S_Category_Type.r6 or S_Category_Type.r7)

checkbox.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased2
checkbox.title: Which brand or brands of [pipe: Category] have you purchased in the past [pipe: Months]?

radio.label: S_Brand_BUMO2
radio.title: And which one brand of [pipe: Category] have you purchased most often in the past [pipe: Months]?

checkbox.label: S_Brand_NonRejecter
checkbox.title: Which brands of [pipe: Category], if any, would you NOT consider purchasing in the future?

autofill.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

autofill.label: S_Brand_BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

block.label: SETQuotas

radio.label: Phase
radio.title: Phase
radio.comment: This is a hide question, will auto hide during the FW.

radio.label: Version
radio.title: Version
radio.comment: This is a hide question, will auto hide during the FW.

row.label: r1
row.autofill: hasMarker('Mp1v1') or hasMarker('Mp1v2') or hasMarker('Mp2v1') or hasMarker('Mp2v2') or hasMarker('Mp3v1') or hasMarker('Mp3v2')

row.label: r2
row.autofill: hasMarker('Bp1v1') or hasMarker('Bp1v2') or hasMarker('Bp2v1') or hasMarker('Bp2v2') or hasMarker('Bp3v1') or hasMarker('Bp3v2')

autofill.label: Usage
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) FULL LIST break out - netted where needed

autofill.label: BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO FULL LIST break out - netted where needed

autofill.label: Child
autofill.title: CHILD FULL LIST break out - netted where needed

autofill.label: User
autofill.title: This is "user" as defined by the insights team - the user by which they are running their data in crosstabs (and thus the norms)- this is defined as either past purchased or BUMO – as instructed by insights. Logic will be the same as S_Brand_PastPurchased OR S_Brand_BUMO.

number.label: resp_id
number.title: Respondent ID

block.label: AgreementBlock
block.note: THIS QUESTION SHOULD BE LEFT IN TO ENSURE QUALITY OF INTERVIEWING AND THAT IT'S NOT A BOT TAKING THE SURVEY

radio.label: RedHerringCheck
radio.title: Which of the following is not an animal?

radio.label: Agreement
radio.title:
Respondent Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (RCDA)
Congratulations!
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally, formerly PRS. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
You will use information or material disclosed to you or which may be available as part of this study only for the purpose of participating in this study, and you will not otherwise use the information or material for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
You agree to keep confidential and not disclose, copy, transmit, or use for any purpose other than your participation in this study any information or material disclosed or made available to you as part of the study, including about products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this study. Any disclosure, copying, transmitting or misuse of any information or material in any form (including hard copy and/or electronic/data) whether intentional or unintentional may subject you to disqualification, and any other remedies available to Behaviorally or its study partners in law or equity.
You agree that Behaviorally (and its partners) will be irreparably harmed and monetary damages may not be adequate compensation if you fail to meet your obligations under this agreement, and that, in addition to other remedies, Behaviorally (or its partners) shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief to prevent any threatened or continued breach. The parties hereby waive any requirements for security for obtaining any provisional relief.
Each of Behaviorally’s partners is an intended third-party beneficiary of this agreement and each partner may enforce the terms of this agreement.
As further detailed in our privacy policy (https://www.behaviorally.com/privacy-policy), we take reasonable precautions to protect the privacy and security of your information during the market research survey. All information collected as part of this survey is treated in accordance with our online privacy policy and is destroyed 2 months after you have taken this survey. You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

row.label: r1
row.b: I hereby acknowledge and agree to the terms.

text.label: DateTime
text.title: DateTime
text.exec:
from datetime import datetime
cur_time = datetime.now() DateTime.val = cur_time.strftime("%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S")

block.label: ShoppingSection
block.builder:title: Shopping Section

pipe.label: continue_text
pipe.case: Please click the Continue button to proceed

block.label: RealEyeExercise
block.builder:title: Real Eye Exercise
block.html: Redirect placeholder so that the redirect executes

autofill.label: EF_Status
autofill.title: Real Eye: Status
autofill.row: Skip (I don't want to participate in this test)

block.term: Real Eye: Skip/ Screen Out/ RealEye OQ

block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: AUTOFILL LOGIC FOR TB MUST BE UPDATED "P1_Items_Bought.r1 or P1_Items_Bought.r2" etc... for all the test products on shelf. Verify with insights team which are test products before writing the logic.
PROGRAMMER NOTE: AUTOFILL LOGIC FOR THE MAIN 2 COMPETITORS IN THE SHOPPING LIST - THIS IS FOR REPORTING PURPOSES AND MUST BE POPULATED
Shopping Question Bank: ShoppingMotivation_OE, ShoppingBarriers_OE, ShoppingBarriers_List are all OPTIONAL
block.html: Throughout this survey, you are going to be shown several pictures. Please be sure that you maximise your window at this time, such that you can see these pictures with as much clarity as possible. You can also mouse over the images to see them magnified at any time.

number.label: P_QuantityPurchased
number.title: Please go shopping for baby toiletry products, assuming you are on a typical shopping trip.

div.ul:
If you would like to see a close-up of a product, hover your mouse over the product.
If you would like to purchase a product, click on the product and use the "+/-" buttons to add quantity and click "Purchase"
To change your mind about purchasing a product, click on the "back" button or click on the shopping cart to remove products.
When finished with the shopping trip, click the "continue" button on the bottom of your screen.
Please be sure to view the entire shelf before proceeding. You may need to scroll over/down to do so.

number.row: Sudocrem Sudocrem Sudosalve Nappy Rash Treatment Cream 25g
Private Label Asda La Nappy Cream
Childs Farm Childs Farm Nappy Cream
Aveeno Aveeno Baby Daily Care Baby Hair & Body Wash 300ml

number.label: P1_Total_Products
number.title: Total Products Purchased
number.virtual: data.val = sum([int(r.c1.val) for r in P_QuantityPurchased.rows if r.c1.val and int(r.c1.val) gt 0])

number.label: P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product
number.title: Total Quantity Purchased Per Product

checkbox.label: P1_Items_Bought
checkbox.title: Products Bought

checkbox.label: P1_Items_ClickedOn
checkbox.title: Products Clicked On

checkbox.label: P1_Items_ClickedOn_NotPurchased
checkbox.title: Products Clicked On, but Not Purchased
checkbox.row: All Items Clicked On Were Purchased

number.label: P1_Number_ClickedOn_Products_NotPurchased
number.title: # of Products Clicked On but NOT Purchased

row.label: TB
row.autofill: P1_Items_Bought.B15 or P1_Items_Bought.B16 or P1_Items_Bought.B17 or P1_Items_Bought.B18 or P1_Items_Bought.B19 or P1_Items_Bought.B20 or P1_Items_Bought.C7 or P1_Items_Bought.C8 or P1_Items_Bought.C9 or P1_Items_Bought.C10 or P1_Items_Bought.C11 or P1_Items_Bought.C12

checkbox.label: R_AidedRecall
checkbox.title: You are now going to see photos of specific products that were on the shelf you saw. For each, please indicate whether or not you saw it during your shopping exercise earlier.

block.label: Findability_Section
block.builder:title: Findability Section
block.html:
Now I am going to show you the display of baby toiletry products again.
This time, you will be looking for one particular item.
Please find [pipe: Finda].
When you find this product, please use your mouse and click on the center of the product to select it.

number.label: F1
number.title:
Again, you are looking for:
[pipe: Finda upper]

radio.label: F1_Item_Found
radio.title: Product Found

radio.label: vFindCorrect
radio.exec: if (Version.r1 and F1.c1.C7.val >0) or (Version.r2 and F1.c1.C10.val >0): vFindCorrect.val = 0 else: vFindCorrect.val = 1

block.note: Findability Question Bank: Differentiation, FamilyFit are OPTIONAL

autofill.label: CorrectlyFound
autofill.title: Correctly Found - Was the Respondent a TestBrand User (based off of Usage)

radio.label: EaseOfFind
radio.title: How easy or difficult do you think it was to find this product?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

block.note: DO NOT MODIFY: EaseOfFind - Filtered by Correctly Located

radio.label: vEaseOfFind
radio.title: DO NOT MODIFY: EaseOfFind - Filtered by Correctly Located How easy or difficult do you think it was to find this product?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

textarea.label: EaseofFinding_B2B
textarea.title: Why do you say that it was difficult to find this product in this display? What would make it easier for you to find this product?
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

checkbox.label: VisualElement
checkbox.title: What visual elements helped you locate/ identify the Johnson’s Baby product you were looking for?
checkbox.row: Icons and graphics on the label
Words and numbers on the label

radio.label: VisualElements_Most
radio.title: And which one visual element helped you most when locating/ identifying the Johnson’s Baby product that you were looking for?
radio.row: Icons and graphics on the label
Words and numbers on the label

radio.label: Differentiation
radio.title: How easy or difficult do you think it is to tell the difference between the Johnson’s Baby products on this shelf?
radio.row: Very easy to tell the difference
Somewhat easy to tell the difference
Neither easy nor difficult to tell the difference
Somewhat difficult to tell the difference
Very difficult to tell the difference

radio.label: FamilyFit
radio.title: How well do the Johnson’s Baby products fit together as a family?

block.label: FlashExposure
block.html: You are now going to be shown a picture on the screen. Please pay attention as it’s going to be a very short exposure.

checkbox.label: F_Practice
checkbox.title: Please review the image below. After 1/2 second, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

textarea.label: F_Practice_OE
textarea.title: Describe what you have just seen. Indicate everything you remember about it, even if you are not completely sure what it is.
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.html: You are now going to be shown another picture on the screen. Please pay attention as it’s going to be a very short exposure.

checkbox.label: F_Flash1
checkbox.title: Please review the image below. After 1/2 second, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

textarea.label: F_Flash1_OE
textarea.title: Describe what you have just seen. Indicate everything you remember about it, even if you are not completely sure what it is.
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.html: You will now see the same picture again. Pay attention as it’s going to be a short exposure.

checkbox.label: F_Flash2
checkbox.title: Please review the image below. After 1 second, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

textarea.label: F_Flash2_OE
textarea.title: What else have you seen?
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.note: Flash3 statement "Clear" is only for Core and Plus. It is not standard for 360 but I gave it a standard label for reporting

radio.label: F_Flash3
radio.title: How much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to this product based on what you have just seen.

div.ul:
10 means that you strongly agree with the statement
1 means that you strongly disagree with the statement
You may choose any number from 1 to 10 that best describes your opinion.

strong.span: Based on what you have just seen, would you say that….

radio.row: The packaging fits very well with what you are looking for when buying baby toiletry products
It is easy to understand what product it is
You recognise this as your usual product / brand

radio.label: Straightliner_Flash3
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch - Just Tracking for Flash3

html.label: IM1
html.span:
You are now going to see a series of statements and products on your screen.
Please pay attention as it's going to be very quick.
As soon as a statement appears you will have 5 seconds to click on the product that best fits with the statement.
Ready? Please continue.

radio.label: IM1B_[loopvar: label]

float.label: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label]
float.title: Pack Attribute Times
float.exec: for row in packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val = float(packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val or 0)

checkbox.label: vIM1A
checkbox.title: Test IAT Summary Table
checkbox.virtual:
if IM1B_0.c1: vIM1A.r0.c1.val=1 if IM1B_0.c2: vIM1A.r0.c2.val=1 if IM1B_0.c3: vIM1A.r0.c3.val=1
if IM1B_2.c1: vIM1A.r2.c1.val=1 if IM1B_2.c2: vIM1A.r2.c2.val=1 if IM1B_2.c3: vIM1A.r2.c3.val=1
if IM1B_3.c1: vIM1A.r3.c1.val=1 if IM1B_3.c2: vIM1A.r3.c2.val=1 if IM1B_3.c3: vIM1A.r3.c3.val=1
if IM1B_4.c1: vIM1A.r4.c1.val=1 if IM1B_4.c2: vIM1A.r4.c2.val=1 if IM1B_4.c3: vIM1A.r4.c3.val=1
if IM1B_5.c1: vIM1A.r5.c1.val=1 if IM1B_5.c2: vIM1A.r5.c2.val=1 if IM1B_5.c3: vIM1A.r5.c3.val=1
if IM1B_6.c1: vIM1A.r6.c1.val=1 if IM1B_6.c2: vIM1A.r6.c2.val=1 if IM1B_6.c3: vIM1A.r6.c3.val=1
if not(data.c1.any): vIM1A.r99.c1.val=1 if not(data.c2.any): vIM1A.r99.c2.val=1 if not(data.c3.any): vIM1A.r99.c3.val=1
checkbox.row: Cluttered - leave this dummy statement in
Did not choose product for any statement
checkbox.col: Comp1 - Programmer make sure this is updated
[pipe: Brand] - Programmer make sure this is updated
Comp2 - Programmer make sure this is updated

block.label: EyeFlowPack

html.label: EF_Pack_Intro
html.strong:
Now, we are going to show you a series of individual products which you may find in your local store. Please look at each product for as long or short a time as you’d like as if considering it for purchase. You can navigate each product and un-blur elements of the packaging that catch your attention.
To start the navigation, please click on the 1st area of the packaging that attracts you. You can then continue to navigate the product by un-blurring further elements of interest.
When finished with the exercise, all you need to do is click on the image one more time.
If you are ready, please click on the “next” button.

block.html: Remember to click/touch the image to start the exercise. Please scroll to see the whole pack.

radio.label: Q_Structure
radio.title: [pipe: Structure_IMG_Test]
radio.comment:
Please focus your attention on the image you see on your screen.
Below are various phrases that could be used to describe the structure of baby toiletry products. How much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to this Johnson’s Baby product?
radio.row: Has a lid that won't break easily

radio.label: Straightliner_Structure
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch

block.label: Attitudinal
block.html:
For the next few questions, please focus your attention on the Johnson’s Baby packaging you see here.
[pipe: PH_IMG]
block.note: Attitudinal Question Bank Question: Q_InitialImpressions is OPTIONAL
Attitudinal Quesiton Bank - THIS IS ALTERNATE IMPLICIT AND IS OPTIONAL- REMOVE IF REGULAR PACKATTS IS USED
Communication "PayMore" is only for Core and Plus. It is not standard for 360 but I gave it a standard label for reporting
Either PI or Propensity will be used here based on the QNR
Attitudinal Question Bank Part 3: Q_Benefit, Benefit_OE, PricePerception, Volume Forecast Block are optional

textarea.label: Q_InitialImpressions
textarea.title: Based on what this Johnson’s Baby packaging shows and tells you, what do you think is new or different about these products? What, if anything is unique about these products relative to others in the category?
textarea.comment:
[pipe: PH_IMG]
Please be as detailed and thorough as possible and indicate whether your response is positive or negative in nature.

radio.label: Q_OA
radio.title: How much do you like or dislike the Johnson’s Baby packaging?

textarea.label: Q_Likes_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: Using your mouse, please highlight the aspects of the packaging that you find most relevant for purchase consideration.
textarea.validate: if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)

checkbox.label: Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label]
checkbox.validate: if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)

textarea.label: Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: Using your mouse, please highlight the aspects of the packaging that you find least relevant for purchase consideration.
textarea.validate: if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)

checkbox.label: Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label]
checkbox.validate: if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)

checkbox.label: Q_PackAtt
checkbox.title: Do you think the Johnson’s Baby packaging is…

radio.label: Q_Communication
radio.title: [pipe: PH_IMG]
radio.comment:
How much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to these Johnson’s Baby products?
These [pipe: Brand] products…
radio.row: Are made by a brand I can trust
Makes me think positively about the Johnson's Baby brand
Makes it easy to tell the product apart

radio.label: Straightliner
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch

radio.label: Q_PropensityToBuy
radio.title:
Assume for a moment that these Johnson’s Baby products available at your local store for the prices shown below. Which of the sentences below most accurately describes what you would do when purchasing baby toiletry products?
Considering my next 10 purchases of baby toiletry products, I would purchase one of these Johnson’s Baby products…
radio.comment:
[pipe: PH_IMG]
Johnson’s Baby, Gold Baby Shampoo 500ml £2.35
Johnson’s Baby, Bedtime Bath 500ml £3.00
Johnson’s Baby Bath 500ml £2.35
Johnson's Baby, Top to Toe Baby Wash 500ml £2.35
Johnson’s Baby, Pink Baby Lotion 500ml £2.35
radio.row: 9 or 10 times out of 10 purchases of baby toiletry products
6 to 8 times out of 10 purchases of baby toiletry products
3 to 5 times out of 10 purchases of baby toiletry products
1 or 2 out of 10 purchases of baby toiletry products

number.label: Q_VariantAllocation
number.cond: Q_PropensityToBuy.r1 or Q_PropensityToBuy.r2 or Q_PropensityToBuy.r3 or Q_PropensityToBuy.r4
number.title:
Specifically, please let me know how your next 10 purchases would spread across the different products of the Johnson’s Baby range.
Please allocate 10 points according to your future purchases within this Johnson’s Baby range. Some products may have 0 points.
Please enter a number for each response, equaling 10.
number.row: Johnson's Baby, Top to Toe Baby Wash 500ml

radio.label: Q_IntendedQuanity
radio.title: And the next time you purchase one of these Johnson’s Baby products, how many packs/ bottles would you buy?

radio.label: Q_Value
radio.title: How do you feel about the value of these products, assuming they were available for the prices shown below?
radio.comment:
[pipe: PH_IMG]
Johnson’s Baby, Gold Baby Shampoo 500ml £2.35
Johnson’s Baby, Bedtime Bath 500ml £3.00
Johnson’s Baby Bath 500ml £2.35
Johnson's Baby, Top to Toe Baby Wash 500ml £2.35
Johnson’s Baby, Pink Baby Lotion 500ml £2.35

radio.label: Q_PI
radio.title: How likely would you be to buy at least one of these Johnson’s Baby products if they were available for the prices shown below?
radio.comment:
[pipe: PH_IMG]
Johnson’s Baby, Gold Baby Shampoo 500ml £2.35
Johnson’s Baby, Bedtime Bath 500ml £3.00
Johnson’s Baby Bath 500ml £2.35
Johnson's Baby, Top to Toe Baby Wash 500ml £2.35
Johnson’s Baby, Pink Baby Lotion 500ml £2.35

radio.label: Q_Alternate
radio.title: Assume for a moment that you are in your usual store and want to buy one of these Johnson’s Baby products, but you cannot find it. Which other product would you buy instead?
radio.row: Another brand baby toiletry product (Not Johnson's Baby)
A store brand baby toiletry product, such as Asda, Tesco etc
I would buy another product in a different category (Please specify:)
I would not buy any other product

survey.html:
We are going to show you the shelf of products again three times, and each time we want you to imagine you have come back to the store on your next shopping trip. Each shelf is different in some way so please take into consideration everything you see, including the prices, when you are deciding what to purchase
As per the initial shopping exercise you conducted earlier, please be sure that you maximise your window at this time, such that you can see these pictures with as much clarity as possible. You can also mouse over the images to see them magnified at any time.

number.label: P_QuantityPurchasedCurrent
number.title: Please go shopping for baby toiletry products, assuming you are on a typical shopping trip.

div.ul:
If you would like to see a close-up of a product, hover your mouse over the product.
If you would like to purchase a product, click on the product and use the "+/-" buttons to add quantity and click "Purchase"
To change your mind about purchasing a product, click on the "back" button or click on the shopping cart to remove products.
When finished with the shopping trip, click the "continue" button on the bottom of your screen.
Please be sure to view the entire shelf before proceeding. You may need to scroll over/down to do so.

strong.em: Now, just a few questions for classification purposes…

select.label: C_Quantity
select.title: Thinking about your typical shopping habits for baby toiletry products, when shopping for this type of product, how many products do you typically purchase in a single shopping trip?

select.label: C_Education
select.title: What was the last year of schooling that you completed?

select.label: C_Employment
select.title: Which of the following best describes your current employment status?

select.label: C_INCOME
select.title: Which range below best represents your total annual household income?
